intro: Pedicularis pseudocephalantha, commonly known as the golden helmet orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky slopes. Its unique floral structure and habitat preferences make it a notable species in botanical studies.
